algorithm_technique: Recursive traversal of the binary tree, identifying left leaves
Recursive traversal of the binary tree, identifying left leaves
problem_summary_simple: Calculate the sum of values of all left leaves in a binary tree.
problem_summary_technical: Recursively traverses a binary tree, summing values of nodes that are leaves and left children.
key_insights: A helper function is used to pass down whether the current node is a left child.
A node is a left leaf if it's a leaf (no left/right children) AND it was reached via a left branch from its parent.
The base case for recursion is a null node, returning 0.
The recursive calls explore both left and right subtrees, accumulating sums from left leaves.
